intro: Gagea nivalis, commonly known as the snow gagea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in early spring. Its bulbous roots are adapted to survive in cold, rocky environments. Gagea nivalis is often found in open meadows and is a characteristic species of high-altitude flora.
